description: TO ELECT A SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE.  VOTES FOR NICHOLAS LONGWORTH (REP) ARE CODED 2; VOTES FOR JOHN N. GARNER (DEM) ARE CODED 1.  (J P. 3-2)
Issue1: Election of the Speaker of the House

description: TO PASS H.R. 1 (P. 10, JUNE 15, 1929), A BILL TO ESTABLISH A FEDERAL FARM BOARD TO PROMOTE EFFECTIVE MERCHANDISING OF AGRICULTURAL COMMODITIES AND TO PLACE AGRICULTURE ON A BASIS OF ECONOMIC EQUALITY WITH OTHER INDUSTRIES.

TO PASS H. RES. 45, PROVIDING THAT UPON THE ADOPTION OF THIS RESOLUTION IT SHALL BE IN ORDER TO MOVE TO TAKE FROM THE SPEAKERS TABLE H.R. 1, (P. 10, 6/15/29) TO PROMOTE EFFECTIVE MERCHANDISING OF AGRICULTURAL COMMODITIES IN INTERSTATE AND FOREIGN COMMERCE, WITH A SENATE AMENDMENT, DISAGREE TO THE SENATE AMENDMENT, AND AGREE TO CONFERENCE ASKED BY THE SENATE, AND THAT THE SPEAKER SHALL IMMEDIATELY APPOINT CONFEREES.  (P. 1448-1)

TO ORDER PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 46, PROVIDING THAT IMMEDIATELY UPON ADOPTION OF THIS RESOLUTION THE HOUSE SHALL RESOLVE ITSELF INTO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE HOUSE FOR THE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 2667, A BILL TO PROVIDE REVENUE AND TO REGULATE COMMERCE WITH FOREIGN COUNTRIES.  (P. 1867-1)
TO PASS H. RES. 46, RESOLVING THE HOUSE INTO COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 2667.  (P. 1867-1)

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 2667 TO COMMITTEE ON WAYS AND MEANS WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO STRIKE OUT THE PROVISIONS CREATING THE U.S. TARIFF COMMISSION AND PROVIDE INSTEAD FOR A BI-PARTISAN FACT FINDING TARIFF COMMISSION AND FURTHER STRIKE OUT CERTAIN SECTION OF THE TARIFF ACT OF 1922 AND AMEND BY ADJUSTING RATES IN ALL SCHEDULES.
TO PASS H.R. 2667.

TO AMEND S. 312 (46 ST. 21, JUNE 18, 1929) A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE FIFTEENTH AND SUBSEQUENT DECENNIAL CENSUSES AND TO PROVIDE FOR APPORTIONMENT OF REPRESENTATIVES IN CONGRESS, BY ELIMINATING THE WORD "UNEMPLOYMENT" FROM THE MATTER ABOUT WHICH INFORMATION IS TO BE GATHERED.  (P. 2455-1)
TO AMEND S. 312, BY ELIMINATING A PROVISION REQUIRING THE GATHERING OF INFORMATION RELATING TO UNEMPLOYMENT AND RADIO SETS.  (P. 2456-1)
TO RECOMMIT S. 312 TO THE COMMITTEE ON CENSUS.
TO PASS S. 312.
TO RECOMMIT S. 312 TO THE COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO HAVE CENSUS TAKEN IN MAY 1930 INSTEAD OF NOV. 1929 AND TO HOLD OUT ON SAID POINT.  (J P. 134-1)

TO RECOMMIT TO CONFERENCE COMMITTEE, H.R. 1 (JUNE 6, 1929), A BILL TO ESTABLISH A FEDERAL FARM BOARD TO PROMOTE EFFECTIVE MERCHANDISING OF AGRICULTURAL COMMODITIES AND TO PLACE AGRICULTURE ON A BASIS OF ECONOMIC EQUALITY WITH OTHER INDUSTRIES, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO INSIST ON STRIKING OUT SENATE AMENDMENT SEC 10, THE SO-CALLED DEBENTURE PLAN. (P. 2788-1)

TO PASS H.J. RES. 80 (P. 20, OCT. 17, 1929) AUTHORIZING THE POSTPONEMENT OF THE DATE OF MATURITY OF THE PRINCIPAL OF THE INDEBTEDNESS OF THE FRENCH REPUBLIC TO THE U.S. IN RESPECT TO THE PURCHASE OF SURPLUS WAR SUPPLIES.
TO PASS H.R. 6585 (P. 24, D C. 18, 1929) A BILL AUTHORIZING THE SETTLEMENT OF THE INDEBTEDNESS OF THE FRENCH REPUBLIC TO THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 853 (P. 229, MAY 5, 1930) TO COMMITTEE ON APPROPRIATIONS, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE TREASURY AND POST OFFICE DEPARTMENTS FOR FISCAL 1931, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REDUCE APPROPRIATIONS FOR OCEAN MAIL SERVICE.
TO PASS H.R. 6153 (P. 107, APR. 10, 1930) A BILL AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO APPOINT A COMMISSION TO STUDY AND REPORT ON THE CONSERVATION AND ADMINISTRATION OF THE PUBLIC DOMAIN.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 8960, (P. 142, APR. 18, 1930) A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENTS OF STATE, JUSTICE AND FOR COMMERCE AND LABOR FOR FISCAL 1931, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO INCREASE APPROPRIATIONS FOR ENFORCEMENT OF ANTI-TRUST LAW.  (P. 2570-1)
TO RECOMMIT TO COMMITTEE, H.R. 119, A BILL PROHIBITING THE SENDING AND RECEIPT OF STOLEN PROPERTY THROUGH INTERSTATE AND FOREIGN COMMERCE.

TO SUSPEND RULES AND PASS H.R. 9806, (P. 330, JUNE 10, 1930) A BILL TO SUSPEND THE CONSTRUCTION OF CERTAIN BRIDGES AND TO EXTEND THE TIMES FOR COMMENCING AND COMPLETING THE CONSTRUCTION OF OTHER BRIDGES OVER THE NAVIGABLE WATERS OF THE UNITED STATES, AS AMENDED.

TO RESOLVE THE HOUSE INTO A COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO CONSIDER H.R. 10288, A BILL REGULATING THE TRANSPORTATION OF PERSONS IN INTERSTATE AND FOREIGN COMMERCE BY MOTOR CARRIERS OPERATING ON THE PUBLIC HIGHWAYS.
TO RESOLVE THE HOUSE INTO A COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 10288.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 10288 WITH INSTRUCTIONS THAT COMMITTEE STRIKE OUT ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE AND INSERT A SUBSTITUTE BILL PROVIDING THAT NO COMMON CARRIER MAY CARRY PASSENGERS FOR HIRE IN INTERSTATE TRANSPORTATION UNLESS THEY HAVE POSTED A SURETY BOND.  (J P. 377-2, 378-1)
TO PASS H.R. 10288.
TO ORDER PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 197 PROVIDING THAT H.R. 2667 WITH SENATE AMENDMENTS THERETO IS DISAGREED TO AND A CONFERENCE IS REQUESTED WITH THE SENATE.
TO PASS H. RES. 197 PROVIDING THAT H.R. 2667 (WITH SENATE AMENDMENTS THERETO) IS DISAGREED TO AND CONFERENCE REQUESTED.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 8960, MAKING APPROPRI- ATIONS FOR DEPARTMENT OF STATE AND JUSTICE, AND FOR THE JUDICIARY, AND FOR THE DEPARTMENTS OF COMMERCE AND LABOR.
TO PASS H.R. 2029 OVER VETO OF THE PRESIDENT, A BILL AUTHORIZING THE COINAGE OF SILVER 50 CENT PIECES IN COMMEMORATION OF THE 75TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE GADSEN PURCHASE.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 10381, A BILL TO AMEND THE WORLD WAR VETERANS ACT OF 1924 AS AMENDED, TO THE COMMITTE ON WORLD WAR VETERANS LEGISLATION, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO STRIKE OUT SEC. 10 AND INSERT A NEW SECTION 10 WHICH AMENDS SEC. 200 OF THE WORLD WAR VETERANS ACT OF 1924, RELATING TO THE COMPENSATION TO BE PAID FOR DEATH OR DISABILITY INCURRED IN SERVICE BETWEEN APRIL 6, 1917 AND JULY 2, 1921. (P. 7672-2, J P. 485-1)
TO PASS H.R. 10381, A BILL AMENDING THE WORLD WAR VETERANS ACT OF 1924 AS AMENDED.

TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON EDUCATION, H.R. 10175 (P. 317, JUNE 9, 1930), A BILL AMENDING AN ACT PROVIDING FOR THE PROMOTION OF VOCATIONAL REHABILITATION OF PERSONS DISABLED APPROVED JUNE 2, 1930 AS AMENDED, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO INCREASE THE APPROPRIATIONS FOR VOCATIONAL REHABILITATION FOR 1930, 1931, 1932, AND 1933.  (P. 7885)
TO AGREE TO REPORT OF CONFERENCE COMMITTEE ON H.R. 2667.
TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT #893 TO H.R. 2667, WHICH AMENDMENT PLACES ON THE FREE LIST CEMENT TO BE USED BY A STATE OR ANY SUB-DIVISION THEREOF. (P. 8150-1)
TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT #371 TO H.R. 2667 WITH AN AMENDMENT FIXING THE DUTY ON CERTAIN LUMBER. (P. 8237-1)
TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT #373 TO H.R. 2667, STRIKING DUTY ON SHINGLES OF WOOD.  (P. 8238-1)
TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN ALL THREE SENATE AMENDMENTS #394, #395 AND #396 TO H.R. 2667, FIXING THE DUTY ON SUGAR FROM CUBA.  (J P. 516-1)
TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT #1128 TO H.R. 2667, REGARDING EXPORT DEBENTURES.  (J P. 518-28519-1, P. 8264-1)

TO RECEDE AND CONCUR IN THE SENATE AMENDMENTS #1140, #1141 AND #1151 TO H.R. 2667, REGARDING TO THE ADJUSTMENT OF DUTIES, THE DEPLETION OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND THE EFFECT OF THE RE-ENACTMENT OF EXISTING LAW.  (P. 8295, 8296, J P. 520-1, 2)
TO INSTRUCT CONFERENCE TO AGREE TO SENATE AMENDMENT 893, THE FREE CEMENT AMENDMENT, TO H.R. 2667.
TO RECOMMIT S. 108 (P. 325, JUNE 10, 1930), A BILL TO SUPPRESS UNFAIR AND FRAUDULENT PRACTICES IN THE MARKETING OF PERISHABLE AGRICULTURAL COMMODITIES IN INTERSTATE AND FOREIGN COMMERCE.

TO ORDER CALL OF THE HOUSE, MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 2152 (P. 304, JUNE 5, 1930), A BILL TO PROMOTE THE AGRICULTURE OF THE U.S. BY EXPANDING IN THE FOREIGN FIELD THE INFORMATION SERVICE NOW RENDERED BY THE U.S. DEPT. OF AGRICULTURE.
TO DIRECT SERGEANT-AT-ARMS TO BRING IN ABSENTEES, MADE DURING DEBATE ON H.R. 2152.
TO ORDER PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H.R. 2152.

TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON FOREIGN AFFAIRS, H.R. 9110 (FEB. 23, 1931), A BILL FOR THE GRADING AND CLASSIFICATION OF CLERKS IN THE FOREIGN SERVICE OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, WITH INSTRUCTIONS THAT COMMITTEE AMEND THE PROVISION FORBIDDING THE PROMOTIONS TO THE GRADE OF SENIOR CLERKS OF NON-AMERICAN CITIZENS, BY FORBIDDING ANY PROMOTION TO NON-CITIZENS.  (P. 9302-1)
TO PASS H.R. 11371, P. 445, JUNE 26, 1930, A BILL PROVIDING LIVING QUARTERS FOR EMPLOYEES OF THE GOVERNMENT IN FOREIGN COUNTRIES.
TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION H.J. RES. 331, RELATIVE TO THE HAGUE CONFERENCE ON THE CODIFICATION OF INTERNATIONAL LAW.

TO AGREE TO REPORT OF CONFERENCE COMMITTEE ON H.R. 2667.
TO SUSPEND THE RULES AND PASS H.R. 9990, (P. 506, JULY 3, 1930), A BILL FOR THE REHABILITATION OF THE BITTER ROOT IRRIGATION PROJECT, MONTANA.

TO INSIST ON DISAGREEMENT TO A SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 10813 (P. 521, JULY 3, 1930), DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA APPROPRIATIONS FOR FISCAL 1931, SAID AMENDMENT INCREASING AN APPROPRIATION THEREIN BY $3 MILLION.  (P. 11016-2)

TO CONCUR IN SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.J. RES. 251 (P. RES. 98, JUNE 27, 1930) PROMOTING PEACE AND TO EQUALIZE THE BURDENS AND MINIMIZE THE PROFIT OF WAR, WHICH AMENDMENT STRIKES OUT "WITHOUT PROFIT" FROM THE PROVISION THAT A COMMITTEE BE APPOINTED TO "STUDY AND CONSIDER AMENDING THE CONSTITUTIONS OF THE U.S. SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT PRIVATE PROPERTY MAY BE TAKEN BY CONGRESS FOR PUBLIC USE WITHOUT PROFIT DURING WAR, AND ALSO STRIKES OUT "SO AS TO EMPOWER THE PRESIDENT IMMEDIATELY TO MOBILIZE ALL THE RESOURCES OF THE COUNTRY." (P. 11335)
TO STRIKE OUT ENACTING CLAUSE OF S. 1721, A BILL DIRECTING THE RETIREMENT OF ACTING ASSISTANT SURGEONS OF THE U.S. NAVY AT THE AGE OF 64 YEARS.

TO AGREE TO H. RES. 271, PROVIDING THAT IT SHALL BE IN ORDER, BEGINNING JUNE 26, 1930, UNTIL THE END OF THE PRESENT SESSION OF THE CONGRESS, FOR THE SPEAKER TO RECOGNIZE MEMBERS FOR MOTIONS TO SUSPEND THE RULES.  (P. 11821-2)

TO SUSPEND RULES AND PASS H.R. 13174 (P. 522, JULY 3, 1930), A BILL AMENDING THE WORLD WAR VETERANS ACT, 1924, AS AMENDED.

TO RESOLVE THE HOUSE INTO COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 11204, A BILL TO ESTABLISH A BORDER PATROL IN THE COAST GUARD IN ORDER TO REGULATE THE ENTRY OF PERSONS INTO THE UNITED STATES.

RES. 447 PROVIDES RELIEF FOR FARMERS IN AREAS OF THE UNITED STATES STRICKEN BY DROUGHT OR STORM.  (P. 2081-1)

TO PASS H. RES. 334, TO TAKE FROM THE SPEAKERS TABLE H.J. RES 447 RELATES TO RELIEF FOR FARMERS IN DROUGHT AND STORM STRICKEN AREAS OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO RECOMMIT TO COMMITTEE ON APPROPRIATIONS, H.R. 16110 (FEB. 23, 1931), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF STATE AND JUSTICE AND FOR THE JUDICIARY AND FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE AND LABOR FOR FISCAL 1932 AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO AMEND BILL BY STRIKING OUT THE APPROPRIATIONS FOR MAINTAINING DISTRICT OFFICES OF THE BUREAU OF STANDARDS. TO PASS H.R. 1036, OVER VETO OF THE PRESIDENT, AN ACT FOR THE RELIEF OF HOMER W. HORINE, TO BRING HIM WITHIN THE LAWS ALLOWING PENSIONS TO SOLDIERS OF THE SPANISH WAR.
TO PASS S. 4142, A BILL TO FIX THE SALARY OF THE GOVERNOR OF THE TERRITORY OF ALASKA.

TO SUSPEND RULES AND PASS H.R. 17054 (P. 743, FEB. 27, 1931) WITH AN AMENDMENT, A BILL TO INCREASE THE LOAN BASIS OF ADJUSTED SERVICE CERTIFICATES, WHICH AMENDMENT AMENDS SECTIONS 502 AND 507 OF WORLD WAR ADJUSTMENT COMPENSATION ACT AS AMENDED SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT LOAN BASIS IS NOT TO BE LESS THAN 50% OF FACE VALUE OF CERTIFICATE, INTEREST AT NOT MORE THAN 4 1/2% AND ALSO PROVIDES WAYS AND MEANS OF RAISING MONEY. TO AGREE TO H.J.
